update.description:
[This PR](https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/pull/827) will make `gazebo_ros_pkgs` depend on ROS 2 master (Crystal candidate), and there's no plan to keep supporting Bouncy, so I'm commenting out bouncy lines, but leaving them there so we could just replace them with crystal once we have some debs available.

FYI @nuclearsandwich
update.title: Bouncy -> Crystal

content.raw: it means to be used in generic by ROS packages. We can probably remove it and trust on the dependency chain.
content.html: it means to be used in generic by ROS packages. We can probably remove it and trust on the dependency chain.

content.raw: It couldn't find it because it hadn't been released yet, but now it has been. But shouldn't it be ok not to install it? It's bringing things which are not needed by `gazebo_ros_pkgs`
content.html: It couldn't find it because it hadn't been released yet, but now it has been. But shouldn't it be ok not to install it? It's bringing things which are not needed by gazebo_ros_pkgs

content.raw: Cool! The failing tests are probably due to [this issue](https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/issues/851). I did notice there seems to be a problem with uncrustify
content.html: Cool! The failing tests are probably due to this issue. I did notice there seems to be a problem with uncrustify

content.raw:
Before merging, I’m quickly test the revert of this change. I don’t see any reason why it can not find the ros-core package. Running the test here:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ros2_gazebo_pkgs-ci-pr_any_crystal-bionic-amd64&build=12)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros2\_gazebo\_pkgs-ci-pr\_any\_crystal-bionic-amd64/12/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros2_gazebo_pkgs-ci-pr_any_crystal-bionic-amd64/12/))

If it compiles fine, I will revert the change and merge the PR.
content.html:
Before merging, I’m quickly test the revert of this change. I don’t see any reason why it can not find the ros-core package. Running the test here:

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros2_gazebo_pkgs-ci-pr_any_crystal-bionic-amd64/12/)

If it compiles fine, I will revert the change and merge the PR.

content.raw:
The -ci-default job just lack the `RTOOLS_BRANCH`param that pointed to this branch. It is compiling, some tests are failing:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ros2_gazebo_pkgs-ci-default_crystal-bionic-amd64&build=6)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros2\_gazebo\_pkgs-ci-default\_crystal-bionic-amd64/6/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros2_gazebo_pkgs-ci-default_crystal-bionic-amd64/6/))
content.html:
The -ci-default job just lack the RTOOLS_BRANCHparam that pointed to this branch. It is compiling, some tests are failing:

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros2_gazebo_pkgs-ci-default_crystal-bionic-amd64/6/)

content.raw: By the way, removed `ros-core` and it builds fine :wink:
content.html: By the way, removed ros-core and it builds fine

content.raw:
After debugging with @scpeters:

* The ci-pr-any job is working: [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ros2_gazebo_pkgs-ci-pr_any_crystal-bionic-amd64&build=3)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros2_gazebo_pkgs-ci-pr_any_crystal-bionic-amd64/3/)

* The default job is not working, it's missing some env variables in the configuration.

I'm inclined to merge this and deal with the default issues later. This way we can test a few PRs before merging them in for the crystal release.
content.html:
After debugging with @scpeters:

  • The ci-pr-any job is working:

  • The default job is not working, it's missing some env variables in the configuration.

I'm inclined to merge this and deal with the default issues later. This way we can test a few PRs before merging them in for the crystal release.

content.raw: Build is failing because `ros-crystal-ros-core` hasn't been released yet. But I wonder if the CI should be using `rosdep` to install just the required dependencies instead of installing the whole core...
content.html: Build is failing because ros-crystal-ros-core hasn't been released yet. But I wonder if the CI should be using rosdep to install just the required dependencies instead of installing the whole core...
